1123345256169312257.text:
This is an amazing free liberal arts college program offered by @BardCollege and the @BKLYNlibrary. For students with a high school degree or equivalent.

No standardized tests. Interview in person at the library.

Find out more and spread the word:https://microcollege.bard.edu/admissions/

1090256300448059392.text:
We're led by a billionaire crook because, for decades, billionaires ran America like a club for their own benefit; and now billionaires promise us they are the solution.

I wrote @WinnersTakeAll for all who ask why we're here and how we set ourselves free. https://www.penguinrandomhouse.com/books/539747/winners-take-all-by-anand-giridharadas/9780451493248/ …

1123224383902879745.text: For a counterpoint to Black, please read the words of @chiaracordelli, with whose wisdom I chose to end my book. She beautifully repudiates this notion of replacing democratic justice with philanthropic justice.pic.twitter.com/ofVSo4PkWq

1123278830658101253.text: But if you're serious about having a dialogue, I will be happy to meet you anywhere in the U.S., if and when you are legally permitted to return here.https://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/national/securities-violations-cost-conrad-black-61-million/article4649024/ …

I was just grading papers and found myself writing this comment. It occurs to me that it would never have occurred to me to write this but for the advocacy and criticism of so many brilliant feminists.

"make sure you're not describing only her -- otherwise it can feel gendered"

To "both sides" the issue, on one hand, my hair was incredibly long at the time, probably because I had a one-year-old and my cut is a long subway ride away.

On the other hand, at least I wasn't the chief prosecutor of Guantanamo Bay, and also it looked a little awesome.
